Title: Around The World in Eighty Days
Abstract: "Around the World in Eighty Days" by Jules Verne is a classic adventure novel published in 1873. The story follows the protagonist, Phileas Fogg, an English gentleman of precise habits, who makes a wager with his fellow members at the Reform Club in London that he can circumnavigate the globe in just eighty days. Accompanied by his loyal servant, Passepartout, Fogg embarks on a journey filled with obstacles, including a detective named Fix who mistakenly believes Fogg to be a bank robber. Along the way, they traverse various countries and encounter a myriad of challenges, from navigating through storms at sea to rescuing a young Indian widow named Aouda. Despite facing numerous setbacks, Fogg remains determined to win the bet and prove that it is indeed possible to travel around the world in such a short amount of time. In the end, Fogg and Passepartout barely make it back to London in time, winning the wager and surprising everyone with their remarkable journey. The novel explores themes of adventure, perseverance, and the transformative power of travel.
Subject: Aventura y Desafío

Title: A Journey to the Centre of the Earth
Abstract: In Hamburg, Professor Lidenbrock lives with his nephew Axel and his girlfriend Graüben. One day, the professor discovers an ancient manuscript from the 16th century that tells how to reach the center of the earth. To do this, they must enter the crater of the Snæfellsjökull volcano in Iceland. The professor embarks on the expedition with Alex and Hans Bjelke, an Icelandic guide. The first few days they experience problems such as the lack of water, the dark tunnels and the vicissitudes of the terrain. As they enter the center of the earth, they encounter dazzling landscapes, huge fossils, a forest of mushrooms, a battle between sea monsters and giant caverns. Axel gets lost from the group, but his companions manage to find him and continue the expedition. It all comes to an end when a volcanic eruption pushes them to the surface of the Estromboli volcano in Italy. Back on land, they return to Germany stunned by the experience.
Subject: Aentura, ciencia ficción y exploración

Title: Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Seas: An Underwater Tour of the World
Abstract: Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Seas: An Underwater Tour of the World is an adventure novel written by Jules Verne, published in 1870 by editorial Pierre-Jules Hetzel in París, Francia. The story follows Professor Pierre Aronnax, who, along with his faithful servant Conseil and the harpooner Ned Land, is captured by the enigmatic Captain Nemo aboard the submarine Nautilus. Throughout their submarine journey around the world, they encounter dangers, discover marine wonders, and explore fascinating locations such as the Canary Islands, the Red Sea, and the legendary Atlantis. The narrative explores themes of science, technology, and human nature as the characters become embroiled in an exciting underwater adventure.
Subject: Viajes y Exploración
